lmpMIB.name: lmpMIB

revisions.description: Revised version: - Fixes textual descriptions of TruthValue settings such that True is always 1 and False is always 2. - Adds punctuation to REFERENCE clauses. This revision published as RFC 4631

lmpMIB.organization: Common Control and Measurement Protocols (CCAMP) Working Group
lmpMIB.contactinfo: Martin Dubuc Email: dubuc.consulting@sympatico.ca Thomas D. Nadeau Email: tnadeau@cisco.com Jonathan P. Lang Email: jplang@ieee.org Evan McGinnis Email: emcginnis@hammerheadsystems.com Adrian Farrel Email: adrian@olddog.co.uk
lmpMIB.description: Copyright (C) 2006 The Internet Society. This version of the MIB module is part of RFC 4631; see the RFC itself for full legal notices. This MIB module contains managed object definitions for the Link Management Protocol (LMP) as defined in 'Link Management Protocol'.

LmpRetransmitInterval.name: LmpRetransmitInterval
LmpRetransmitInterval.description: The retransmission interval delay in milliseconds.

LmpNodeId.name: LmpNodeId
LmpNodeId.description: Represents a Node ID in network byte order. Node ID is an address of type IPv4.
LmpNodeId.reference: Section 1.1 of Link Management Protocol, RFC 4204.

lmpAdminStatus.name: lmpAdminStatus
lmpAdminStatus.description: The desired operational status of LMP on the node. Implementations should save the value of this object in persistent memory so that it survives restarts or reboot.

lmpOperStatus.name: lmpOperStatus
lmpOperStatus.description: The actual operational status of LMP on the node.

lmpNbrTable.name: lmpNbrTable
lmpNbrTable.description: This table specifies the neighbor node(s) to which control channels may be established.

lmpNbrEntry.name: lmpNbrEntry
lmpNbrEntry.description: An entry in this table is created by a LMP-enabled device for every pair of nodes that can establish control channels.

lmpNbrNodeId.name: lmpNbrNodeId
lmpNbrNodeId.description: This is a unique index for an entry in the LmpNbrTable. This value represents the remote Node ID.

lmpNbrRetransmitInterval.name: lmpNbrRetransmitInterval
lmpNbrRetransmitInterval.reference: Link Management Protocol, RFC 4204. Congestion Control Principles, RFC 2914.
lmpNbrRetransmitInterval.description: This object specifies the initial retransmission interval that is used for the retransmission of messages that require acknowledgement. This object, along with lmpNbrRetryLimit, is used to implement the congestion-handling mechanism defined in Section 10 of the Link Management Protocol specification, which is based on RFC 2914.

lmpNbrRetryLimit.name: lmpNbrRetryLimit
lmpNbrRetryLimit.reference: Link Management Protocol, RFC 4204. Congestion Control Principles, RFC 2914.
lmpNbrRetryLimit.description: This object specifies the maximum number of times a message is transmitted without being acknowledged. A value of 0 is used to indicate that a node should never stop retransmission. This object, along with lmpNbrRetransmitInterval, is used to implement the congestion-handling mechanism as defined in Section 10 of the Link Management Protocol specification, which is based on RFC 2914.

lmpNbrRetransmitDelta.name: lmpNbrRetransmitDelta
lmpNbrRetransmitDelta.reference: Link Management Protocol, RFC 4204. Congestion Control Principles, RFC 2914.
lmpNbrRetransmitDelta.description: This object governs the speed with which the sender increases the retransmission interval, as explained in Section 10 of the Link Management Protocol specification, which is based on RFC 2914. This value is a power used to express the exponential backoff. The ratio of two successive retransmission intervals is (1 + Delta).

lmpNbrAdminStatus.name: lmpNbrAdminStatus
lmpNbrAdminStatus.description: The desired operational status of LMP to this remote node.

lmpNbrOperStatus.name: lmpNbrOperStatus
lmpNbrOperStatus.description: The actual operational status of LMP to this remote node.

lmpNbrRowStatus.name: lmpNbrRowStatus
lmpNbrRowStatus.description: This variable is used to create, modify, and/or delete a row in this table. None of the writable objects in a row can be changed if the status is active(1). All read-create objects must have valid and consistent values before the row can be activated.

lmpNbrStorageType.name: lmpNbrStorageType
lmpNbrStorageType.description: The storage type for this conceptual row in the lmpNbrTable. Conceptual rows having the value 'permanent' need not allow write-access to any columnar object in the row.

lmpCcHelloIntervalDefault.name: lmpCcHelloIntervalDefault
lmpCcHelloIntervalDefault.description: This object specifies the default value for the HelloInterval parameter used in the Hello protocol keep-alive phase. It indicates how frequently LMP Hello messages will be sent. It is used as the default value for lmpCcHelloInterval. Implementations should save the value of this object in persistent memory so that it survives restarts or reboot.

lmpCcHelloIntervalDefaultMin.name: lmpCcHelloIntervalDefaultMin
lmpCcHelloIntervalDefaultMin.description: This object specifies the default minimum value for the HelloInterval parameter. It is used as a default value for lmpCcHelloIntervalMin. Implementations should save the value of this object in persistent memory so that it survives restarts or reboot.

lmpCcHelloIntervalDefaultMax.name: lmpCcHelloIntervalDefaultMax
lmpCcHelloIntervalDefaultMax.description: This object specifies the default maximum value for the HelloInterval parameter. It is used as a default value for lmpCcHelloIntervalMax. Implementations should save the value of this object in persistent memory so that it survives restarts or reboot.

lmpCcHelloDeadIntervalDefault.name: lmpCcHelloDeadIntervalDefault
lmpCcHelloDeadIntervalDefault.description: This object specifies the default HelloDeadInterval parameter to use in the Hello protocol keep-alive phase. It indicates how long a device should wait before declaring the control channel dead. The HelloDeadInterval parameter should be at least three times the value of HelloInterval. It is used as a default value for lmpCcHelloDeadInterval. Implementations should save the value of this object in persistent memory so that it survives restarts or reboot.

lmpCcHelloDeadIntervalDefaultMin.name: lmpCcHelloDeadIntervalDefaultMin
lmpCcHelloDeadIntervalDefaultMin.description: This object specifies the default minimum value for the HelloDeadInterval parameter. It is used as a default value for lmpCcHelloDeadIntervalMin. Implementations should save the value of this object in persistent memory so that it survives restarts or reboot.

lmpCcHelloDeadIntervalDefaultMax.name: lmpCcHelloDeadIntervalDefaultMax
lmpCcHelloDeadIntervalDefaultMax.description: This object specifies the default maximum value for the HelloDeadInterval parameter. It is used as a default value for lmpCcHelloDeadIntervalMax. Implementations should save the value of this object in persistent memory so that it survives restarts or reboot.

lmpControlChannelTable.name: lmpControlChannelTable
lmpControlChannelTable.description: This table specifies LMP control channel information.

lmpControlChannelEntry.name: lmpControlChannelEntry
lmpControlChannelEntry.description: An entry in this table is created by an LMP-enabled device for every control channel. Whenever a new entry is created with lmpCcIsIf set to true(1), a corresponding entry is created in ifTable as well (see RFC 2863).

lmpCcId.name: lmpCcId
lmpCcId.description: This value represents the local control channel identifier. The control channel identifier is a non-zero 32-bit number.

lmpCcUnderlyingIfIndex.name: lmpCcUnderlyingIfIndex
lmpCcUnderlyingIfIndex.description: If lmpCcIsIf is set to true(1), this object carries the index into the ifTable of the entry that represents the LMP interface over which LMP will transmit its traffic. If this object is set to zero but lmpCcIsIf is set to true(1), the control channel is not currently associated with any underlying interface, and the control channel's operational status must not be up(1); nor should the control channel forward or receive traffic. If lmpCcIsIf is set to false(2), this object should be set to zero and ignored.

lmpCcIsIf.name: lmpCcIsIf
lmpCcIsIf.description: In implementations where the control channels are modeled as interfaces, the value of this object is true(1), and this control channel is represented by an interface in the interfaces group table as indicated by the value of lmpCcUnderlyingIfIndex. If control channels are not modeled as interfaces, the value of this object is false(2), and there is no corresponding interface for this control channel in the interfaces group table; the value of lmpCcUnderlyingIfIndex should be ignored.

lmpCcNbrNodeId.name: lmpCcNbrNodeId
lmpCcNbrNodeId.description: This is the Node ID of the control channel remote node. This value either is configured or gets created by the node when a Config message is received or when an outgoing Config message is acknowledged by the remote node.

lmpCcRemoteId.name: lmpCcRemoteId
lmpCcRemoteId.description: This value represents the remote control channel identifier (32-bit number). It is determined during the negotiation phase. A value of zero means that the remote control channel identifier has not yet been learned.

lmpCcRemoteAddressType.name: lmpCcRemoteAddressType
lmpCcRemoteAddressType.description: This value represents the remote control channel IP address type. In point-to-point configuration, this value can be set to unknown(0).

lmpCcRemoteIpAddr.name: lmpCcRemoteIpAddr
lmpCcRemoteIpAddr.description: This value represents the remote control channel Internet address for numbered control channel. The type of this address is determined by lmpCcRemoteAddressType. The control channel must be numbered on non-point-to-point configuration. For point-to-point configuration, the remote control channel address can be of type unknown, in which case this object must be a zero-length string. The lmpCcRemoteId object then identifies the unnumbered address.

lmpCcSetupRole.name: lmpCcSetupRole
lmpCcSetupRole.description: The role that this node should take during establishment of this control channel. An active node will initiate establishment. A passive node will wait for the remote node to initiate. A pair of nodes that both take the passive role will never establish communications.

lmpCcAuthentication.name: lmpCcAuthentication
lmpCcAuthentication.description: This object indicates whether the control channel must use authentication.

lmpCcHelloInterval.name: lmpCcHelloInterval
lmpCcHelloInterval.description: This object specifies the value of the HelloInterval parameter. The default value for this object should be set to lmpCcHelloIntervalDefault.

lmpCcHelloIntervalMin.name: lmpCcHelloIntervalMin
lmpCcHelloIntervalMin.description: This object specifies the minimum value for the HelloInterval parameter. The default value for this object should be set to lmpCcHelloIntervalMinDefault.

lmpCcHelloIntervalMax.name: lmpCcHelloIntervalMax
lmpCcHelloIntervalMax.description: This object specifies the maximum value for the HelloInterval parameter. The default value for this object should be set to lmpCcHelloIntervalMaxDefault.

lmpCcHelloIntervalNegotiated.name: lmpCcHelloIntervalNegotiated
lmpCcHelloIntervalNegotiated.description: Once the control channel is active, this object represents the negotiated HelloInterval value.

lmpCcHelloDeadInterval.name: lmpCcHelloDeadInterval
lmpCcHelloDeadInterval.description: This object specifies the value of the HelloDeadInterval parameter. The default value for this object should be set to lmpCcHelloDeadIntervalDefault.

lmpCcHelloDeadIntervalMin.name: lmpCcHelloDeadIntervalMin
lmpCcHelloDeadIntervalMin.description: This object specifies the minimum value for the HelloDeadInterval parameter. The default value for this object should be set to lmpCcHelloDeadIntervalMinDefault.

lmpCcHelloDeadIntervalMax.name: lmpCcHelloDeadIntervalMax
lmpCcHelloDeadIntervalMax.description: This object specifies the maximum value for the HelloDeadInterval parameter. The default value for this object should be set to lmpCcHelloIntervalMaxDefault.

lmpCcHelloDeadIntervalNegotiated.name: lmpCcHelloDeadIntervalNegotiated
lmpCcHelloDeadIntervalNegotiated.description: Once the control channel is active, this object represents the negotiated HelloDeadInterval value.

lmpCcLastChange.name: lmpCcLastChange
lmpCcLastChange.description: The value of sysUpTime at the time the control channel entered its current operational state. If the current state was entered prior to the last re-initialization of the local network management subsystem, then this object contains a zero value.

lmpCcAdminStatus.name: lmpCcAdminStatus
lmpCcAdminStatus.description: The desired operational status of this control channel.

lmpCcOperStatus.name: lmpCcOperStatus
lmpCcOperStatus.description: The actual operational status of this control channel.

lmpCcRowStatus.name: lmpCcRowStatus
lmpCcRowStatus.description: This variable is used to create, modify, and/or delete a row in this table. None of the writable objects in a row can be changed if the status is active(1). All read-create objects must have valid and consistent values before the row can be activated.

lmpCcStorageType.name: lmpCcStorageType
lmpCcStorageType.description: The storage type for this conceptual row in the lmpControlChannelTable. Conceptual rows having the value 'permanent' need not allow write-access to any columnar object in the row.

lmpControlChannelPerfTable.name: lmpControlChannelPerfTable
lmpControlChannelPerfTable.description: This table specifies LMP control channel performance counters.

lmpControlChannelPerfEntry.name: lmpControlChannelPerfEntry
lmpControlChannelPerfEntry.description: An entry in this table is created by a LMP-enabled device for every control channel. lmpCcCounterDiscontinuityTime is used to indicate potential discontinuity for all counter objects in this table.

lmpCcInOctets.name: lmpCcInOctets
lmpCcInOctets.description: The total number of LMP message octets received on the control channel.

lmpCcInDiscards.name: lmpCcInDiscards
lmpCcInDiscards.description: The number of inbound packets that were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

lmpCcInErrors.name: lmpCcInErrors
lmpCcInErrors.description: The number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being processed by LMP.

lmpCcOutOctets.name: lmpCcOutOctets
lmpCcOutOctets.description: The total number of LMP message octets transmitted out of the control channel.

lmpCcOutDiscards.name: lmpCcOutDiscards
lmpCcOutDiscards.description: The number of outbound packets that were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

lmpCcOutErrors.name: lmpCcOutErrors
lmpCcOutErrors.description: The number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors.

lmpCcConfigReceived.name: lmpCcConfigReceived
lmpCcConfigReceived.description: This object counts the number of Config messages that have been received on this control channel.

lmpCcConfigSent.name: lmpCcConfigSent
lmpCcConfigSent.description: This object counts the number of Config messages that have been sent on this control channel.

lmpCcConfigRetransmit.name: lmpCcConfigRetransmit
lmpCcConfigRetransmit.description: This object counts the number of Config messages that have been retransmitted over this control channel.

lmpCcConfigAckReceived.name: lmpCcConfigAckReceived
lmpCcConfigAckReceived.description: This object counts the number of ConfigAck messages that have been received on this control channel.

lmpCcConfigAckSent.name: lmpCcConfigAckSent
lmpCcConfigAckSent.description: This object counts the number of ConfigAck messages that have been sent on this control channel.

lmpCcConfigNackReceived.name: lmpCcConfigNackReceived
lmpCcConfigNackReceived.description: This object counts the number of ConfigNack messages that have been received on this control channel.

lmpCcConfigNackSent.name: lmpCcConfigNackSent
lmpCcConfigNackSent.description: This object counts the number of ConfigNack messages that have been sent on this control channel.

lmpCcHelloReceived.name: lmpCcHelloReceived
lmpCcHelloReceived.description: This object counts the number of Hello messages that have been received on this control channel.

lmpCcHelloSent.name: lmpCcHelloSent
lmpCcHelloSent.description: This object counts the number of Hello messages that have been sent on this control channel.

lmpCcBeginVerifyReceived.name: lmpCcBeginVerifyReceived
lmpCcBeginVerifyReceived.description: This object counts the number of BeginVerify messages that have been received on this control channel.

lmpCcBeginVerifySent.name: lmpCcBeginVerifySent
lmpCcBeginVerifySent.description: This object counts the number of BeginVerify messages that have been sent on this control channel.

lmpCcBeginVerifyRetransmit.name: lmpCcBeginVerifyRetransmit
lmpCcBeginVerifyRetransmit.description: This object counts the number of BeginVerify messages that have been retransmitted over this control channel.

lmpCcBeginVerifyAckReceived.name: lmpCcBeginVerifyAckReceived
lmpCcBeginVerifyAckReceived.description: This object counts the number of BeginVerifyAck messages that have been received on this control channel.

lmpCcBeginVerifyAckSent.name: lmpCcBeginVerifyAckSent
lmpCcBeginVerifyAckSent.description: This object counts the number of BeginVerifyAck messages that have been sent on this control channel.

lmpCcBeginVerifyNackReceived.name: lmpCcBeginVerifyNackReceived
lmpCcBeginVerifyNackReceived.description: This object counts the number of BeginVerifyNack messages that have been received on this control channel.

lmpCcBeginVerifyNackSent.name: lmpCcBeginVerifyNackSent
lmpCcBeginVerifyNackSent.description: This object counts the number of BeginVerifyNack messages that have been sent on this control channel.

lmpCcEndVerifyReceived.name: lmpCcEndVerifyReceived
lmpCcEndVerifyReceived.description: This object counts the number of EndVerify messages that have been received on this control channel.

lmpCcEndVerifySent.name: lmpCcEndVerifySent
lmpCcEndVerifySent.description: This object counts the number of EndVerify messages that have been sent on this control channel.

lmpCcEndVerifyRetransmit.name: lmpCcEndVerifyRetransmit
lmpCcEndVerifyRetransmit.description: This object counts the number of EndVerify messages that have been retransmitted over this control channel.

lmpCcEndVerifyAckReceived.name: lmpCcEndVerifyAckReceived
lmpCcEndVerifyAckReceived.description: This object counts the number of EndVerifyAck messages that have been received on this control channel.

lmpCcEndVerifyAckSent.name: lmpCcEndVerifyAckSent
lmpCcEndVerifyAckSent.description: This object counts the number of EndVerifyAck messages that have been sent on this control channel.

lmpCcTestStatusSuccessReceived.name: lmpCcTestStatusSuccessReceived
lmpCcTestStatusSuccessReceived.description: This object counts the number of TestStatusSuccess messages that have been received on this control channel.

lmpCcTestStatusSuccessSent.name: lmpCcTestStatusSuccessSent
lmpCcTestStatusSuccessSent.description: This object counts the number of TestStatusSuccess messages that have been sent on this control channel.

lmpCcTestStatusSuccessRetransmit.name: lmpCcTestStatusSuccessRetransmit
lmpCcTestStatusSuccessRetransmit.description: This object counts the number of TestStatusSuccess messages that have been retransmitted over this control channel.

lmpCcTestStatusFailureReceived.name: lmpCcTestStatusFailureReceived
lmpCcTestStatusFailureReceived.description: This object counts the number of TestStatusFailure messages that have been received on this control channel.

lmpCcTestStatusFailureSent.name: lmpCcTestStatusFailureSent
lmpCcTestStatusFailureSent.description: This object counts the number of TestStatusFailure messages that have been sent on this control channel.

lmpCcTestStatusFailureRetransmit.name: lmpCcTestStatusFailureRetransmit
lmpCcTestStatusFailureRetransmit.description: This object counts the number of TestStatusFailure messages that have been retransmitted over this control channel.

lmpCcTestStatusAckReceived.name: lmpCcTestStatusAckReceived
lmpCcTestStatusAckReceived.description: This object counts the number of TestStatusAck messages that have been received on this control channel.

lmpCcTestStatusAckSent.name: lmpCcTestStatusAckSent
lmpCcTestStatusAckSent.description: This object counts the number of TestStatusAck messages that have been sent on this control channel.

lmpCcLinkSummaryReceived.name: lmpCcLinkSummaryReceived
lmpCcLinkSummaryReceived.description: This object counts the number of LinkSummary messages that have been received on this control channel.

lmpCcLinkSummarySent.name: lmpCcLinkSummarySent
lmpCcLinkSummarySent.description: This object counts the number of LinkSummary messages that have been sent on this control channel.

lmpCcLinkSummaryRetransmit.name: lmpCcLinkSummaryRetransmit
lmpCcLinkSummaryRetransmit.description: This object counts the number of LinkSummary messages that have been retransmitted over this control channel.

lmpCcLinkSummaryAckReceived.name: lmpCcLinkSummaryAckReceived
lmpCcLinkSummaryAckReceived.description: This object counts the number of LinkSummaryAck messages that have been received on this control channel.

lmpCcLinkSummaryAckSent.name: lmpCcLinkSummaryAckSent
lmpCcLinkSummaryAckSent.description: This object counts the number of LinkSummaryAck messages that have been sent on this control channel.

lmpCcLinkSummaryNackReceived.name: lmpCcLinkSummaryNackReceived
lmpCcLinkSummaryNackReceived.description: This object counts the number of LinkSummaryNack messages that have been received on this control channel.

lmpCcLinkSummaryNackSent.name: lmpCcLinkSummaryNackSent
lmpCcLinkSummaryNackSent.description: This object counts the number of LinkSummaryNack messages that have been sent on this control channel.

lmpCcChannelStatusReceived.name: lmpCcChannelStatusReceived
lmpCcChannelStatusReceived.description: This object counts the number of ChannelStatus messages that have been received on this control channel.

lmpCcChannelStatusSent.name: lmpCcChannelStatusSent
lmpCcChannelStatusSent.description: This object counts the number of ChannelStatus messages that have been sent on this control channel.

lmpCcChannelStatusRetransmit.name: lmpCcChannelStatusRetransmit
lmpCcChannelStatusRetransmit.description: This object counts the number of ChannelStatus messages that have been retransmitted on this control channel.

lmpCcChannelStatusAckReceived.name: lmpCcChannelStatusAckReceived
lmpCcChannelStatusAckReceived.description: This object counts the number of ChannelStatusAck messages that have been received on this control channel.

lmpCcChannelStatusAckSent.name: lmpCcChannelStatusAckSent
lmpCcChannelStatusAckSent.description: This object counts the number of ChannelStatus messages that have been sent on this control channel.

lmpCcChannelStatusReqReceived.name: lmpCcChannelStatusReqReceived
lmpCcChannelStatusReqReceived.description: This object counts the number of ChannelStatusRequest messages that have been received on this control channel.

lmpCcChannelStatusReqSent.name: lmpCcChannelStatusReqSent
lmpCcChannelStatusReqSent.description: This object counts the number of ChannelStatusRequest messages that have been sent on this control channel.

lmpCcChannelStatusReqRetransmit.name: lmpCcChannelStatusReqRetransmit
lmpCcChannelStatusReqRetransmit.description: This object counts the number of ChannelStatusRequest messages that have been retransmitted on this control channel.

lmpCcChannelStatusRspReceived.name: lmpCcChannelStatusRspReceived
lmpCcChannelStatusRspReceived.description: This object counts the number of ChannelStatusResponse messages that have been received on this control channel.

lmpCcChannelStatusRspSent.name: lmpCcChannelStatusRspSent
lmpCcChannelStatusRspSent.description: This object counts the number of ChannelStatusResponse messages that have been sent on this control channel.

lmpCcCounterDiscontinuityTime.name: lmpCcCounterDiscontinuityTime
lmpCcCounterDiscontinuityTime.description: The value of sysUpTime on the most recent occasion at which one or more of this control channel's counters suffered a discontinuity. The relevant counters are the specific instances associated with this control channel of any Counter32 object contained in the lmpControlChannelPerfTable. If no such discontinuities have occurred since the last re- initialization of the local management subsystem, then this object contains a zero value.

lmpTeLinkTable.name: lmpTeLinkTable
lmpTeLinkTable.description: This table specifies the LMP-specific TE link information. Overall TE link information is kept in three separate tables: ifTable for interface-specific information, lmpTeLinkTable for LMP specific information, and teLinkTable for generic TE link information. ifIndex is the common index to all tables.

lmpTeLinkEntry.name: lmpTeLinkEntry
lmpTeLinkEntry.description: An entry in this table exists for each ifEntry with an ifType of teLink(200) that is managed by LMP. An ifEntry with an ifIndex must exist before the corresponding lmpTeLinkEntry is created. If a TE link entry in the ifTable is destroyed, then so is the corresponding entry in the lmpTeLinkTable. The administrative status value is controlled from the ifEntry. Setting the administrative status to testing prompts LMP to start link verification on the TE link. Information about the TE link that is not LMP specific is contained in the teLinkTable of the TE-LINK-STD-MIB MIB module.

lmpTeLinkNbrRemoteNodeId.name: lmpTeLinkNbrRemoteNodeId
lmpTeLinkNbrRemoteNodeId.description: This is the Node ID of the TE link remote node. This value may be learned during the control channel parameter negotiation phase (in the Config message). Node ID is an address whose type must be IPv4.

lmpTeLinkVerification.name: lmpTeLinkVerification
lmpTeLinkVerification.description: This object indicates whether the LMP link verification procedure is enabled for this TE link.

lmpTeLinkFaultManagement.name: lmpTeLinkFaultManagement
lmpTeLinkFaultManagement.description: This object indicates whether the LMP fault management procedure is enabled on this TE link.

lmpTeLinkDwdm.name: lmpTeLinkDwdm
lmpTeLinkDwdm.reference: Link Management Protocol (LMP) for Dense Wavelength Division Multiplexing (DWDM) Optical Line Systems, RFC 4209.
lmpTeLinkDwdm.description: This object indicates whether the LMP DWDM procedure is enabled on this TE link.

lmpTeLinkOperStatus.name: lmpTeLinkOperStatus
lmpTeLinkOperStatus.description: The actual operational status of this TE link. The status is set to testing when the TE link is performing link verification. A degraded state indicates that there is no active control channel between the pair of nodes that form the endpoints of the TE link, but that at least one data-bearing link on the TE link is allocated.

lmpTeLinkRowStatus.name: lmpTeLinkRowStatus
lmpTeLinkRowStatus.description: This variable is used to create, modify, and/or delete a row in this table. None of the writable objects in a row can be changed if the status is active(1). All read-create objects must have valid and consistent values before the row can be activated.

lmpTeLinkStorageType.name: lmpTeLinkStorageType
lmpTeLinkStorageType.description: The storage type for this conceptual row in the lmpTeLinkTable. Conceptual rows having the value 'permanent' need not allow write-access to any columnar object in the row.

lmpGlobalLinkVerificationInterval.name: lmpGlobalLinkVerificationInterval
lmpGlobalLinkVerificationInterval.description: This object indicates how often the link verification procedure is executed. The interval is in milliseconds. A value of 0 is used to indicate that the link verification procedure should not be executed. The interval specified in this object should be large enough to allow the verification procedure to be completed before the start of the next interval. Implementations should save the value of this object in persistent memory so that it survives restarts or reboot.

lmpLinkVerificationTable.name: lmpLinkVerificationTable
lmpLinkVerificationTable.description: This table specifies TE link information associated with the LMP verification procedure.

lmpLinkVerificationEntry.name: lmpLinkVerificationEntry
lmpLinkVerificationEntry.description: An entry in this table is created by an LMP-enabled device for every TE link that supports the LMP verification procedure.

lmpLinkVerifyInterval.name: lmpLinkVerifyInterval
lmpLinkVerifyInterval.description: This object specifies the VerifyInterval parameter used in the LMP link verification process. It indicates the interval at which the Test messages are sent.

lmpLinkVerifyDeadInterval.name: lmpLinkVerifyDeadInterval
lmpLinkVerifyDeadInterval.description: This object specifies the VerifyDeadInterval parameter used in the verification of the physical connectivity of data- bearing links. It specifies the observation period used to detect a Test message at the remote node.

lmpLinkVerifyTransportMechanism.name: lmpLinkVerifyTransportMechanism
lmpLinkVerifyTransportMechanism.reference: Link Management Protocol, RFC 4204 Synchronous Optical Network (SONET)/Synchronous Digital Hierarchy (SDH) Encoding for Link Management Protocol (LMP) Test Messages, RFC 4207.
lmpLinkVerifyTransportMechanism.description: This defines the transport mechanism for the Test messages. The scope of this bit mask is restricted to each link encoding type. The local node will set the bits corresponding to the various mechanisms it can support for transmitting LMP Test messages. The receiver chooses the appropriate mechanism in the BeginVerifyAck message.

lmpLinkVerifyAllLinks.name: lmpLinkVerifyAllLinks
lmpLinkVerifyAllLinks.description: A value of true(1) for this object indicates that the verification process checks all unallocated links; otherwise, only the new ports or component links that have been added to this TE link are verified.

lmpLinkVerifyTransmissionRate.name: lmpLinkVerifyTransmissionRate
lmpLinkVerifyTransmissionRate.description: This is the transmission rate of the data link over which the Test messages will be transmitted and is expressed in bytes per second.

lmpLinkVerifyWavelength.name: lmpLinkVerifyWavelength
lmpLinkVerifyWavelength.description: This value corresponds to the wavelength at which the Test messages will be transmitted and is measured in nanometers (nm). If each data-bearing link corresponds to a separate wavelength, then this value should be set to 0.

lmpLinkVerifyRowStatus.name: lmpLinkVerifyRowStatus
lmpLinkVerifyRowStatus.description: This variable is used to create, modify, and/or delete a row in this table. None of the writable objects in a row can be changed if the status is active(1). All read-create objects must have valid and consistent values before the row can be activated.

lmpLinkVerifyStorageType.name: lmpLinkVerifyStorageType
lmpLinkVerifyStorageType.description: The storage type for this conceptual row in the lmpLinkVerificationTable. Conceptual rows having the value 'permanent' need not allow write-access to any columnar object in the row.

lmpTeLinkPerfTable.name: lmpTeLinkPerfTable
lmpTeLinkPerfTable.description: This table specifies LMP TE link performance counters.

lmpTeLinkPerfEntry.name: lmpTeLinkPerfEntry
lmpTeLinkPerfEntry.description: An entry in this table is created by an LMP-enabled device for every TE link. lmpTeCounterDiscontinuityTime is used to indicate potential discontinuity for all counter objects in this table.

lmpTeInOctets.name: lmpTeInOctets
lmpTeInOctets.description: The total number of LMP message octets received for this TE link.

lmpTeOutOctets.name: lmpTeOutOctets
lmpTeOutOctets.description: The total number of LMP message octets transmitted out for this TE link.

lmpTeBeginVerifyReceived.name: lmpTeBeginVerifyReceived
lmpTeBeginVerifyReceived.description: This object counts the number of BeginVerify messages that have been received for this TE link.

lmpTeBeginVerifySent.name: lmpTeBeginVerifySent
lmpTeBeginVerifySent.description: This object counts the number of BeginVerify messages that have been sent for this TE link.

lmpTeBeginVerifyRetransmit.name: lmpTeBeginVerifyRetransmit
lmpTeBeginVerifyRetransmit.description: This object counts the number of BeginVerify messages that have been retransmitted for this TE link.

lmpTeBeginVerifyAckReceived.name: lmpTeBeginVerifyAckReceived
lmpTeBeginVerifyAckReceived.description: This object counts the number of BeginVerifyAck messages that have been received for this TE link.

lmpTeBeginVerifyAckSent.name: lmpTeBeginVerifyAckSent
lmpTeBeginVerifyAckSent.description: This object counts the number of BeginVerifyAck messages that have been sent for this TE link.

lmpTeBeginVerifyNackReceived.name: lmpTeBeginVerifyNackReceived
lmpTeBeginVerifyNackReceived.description: This object counts the number of BeginVerifyNack messages that have been received for this TE link.

lmpTeBeginVerifyNackSent.name: lmpTeBeginVerifyNackSent
lmpTeBeginVerifyNackSent.description: This object counts the number of BeginVerifyNack messages that have been sent for this TE link.

lmpTeEndVerifyReceived.name: lmpTeEndVerifyReceived
lmpTeEndVerifyReceived.description: This object counts the number of EndVerify messages that have been received for this TE link.

lmpTeEndVerifySent.name: lmpTeEndVerifySent
lmpTeEndVerifySent.description: This object counts the number of EndVerify messages that have been sent for this TE link.

lmpTeEndVerifyRetransmit.name: lmpTeEndVerifyRetransmit
lmpTeEndVerifyRetransmit.description: This object counts the number of EndVerify messages that have been retransmitted over this control channel.

lmpTeEndVerifyAckReceived.name: lmpTeEndVerifyAckReceived
lmpTeEndVerifyAckReceived.description: This object counts the number of EndVerifyAck messages that have been received for this TE link.

lmpTeEndVerifyAckSent.name: lmpTeEndVerifyAckSent
lmpTeEndVerifyAckSent.description: This object counts the number of EndVerifyAck messages that have been sent for this TE link.

lmpTeTestStatusSuccessReceived.name: lmpTeTestStatusSuccessReceived
lmpTeTestStatusSuccessReceived.description: This object counts the number of TestStatusSuccess messages that have been received for this TE link.

lmpTeTestStatusSuccessSent.name: lmpTeTestStatusSuccessSent
lmpTeTestStatusSuccessSent.description: This object counts the number of TestStatusSuccess messages that have been sent for this TE link.

lmpTeTestStatusSuccessRetransmit.name: lmpTeTestStatusSuccessRetransmit
lmpTeTestStatusSuccessRetransmit.description: This object counts the number of TestStatusSuccess messages that have been retransmitted for this TE link.

lmpTeTestStatusFailureReceived.name: lmpTeTestStatusFailureReceived
lmpTeTestStatusFailureReceived.description: This object counts the number of TestStatusFailure messages that have been received for this TE link.

lmpTeTestStatusFailureSent.name: lmpTeTestStatusFailureSent
lmpTeTestStatusFailureSent.description: This object counts the number of TestStatusFailure messages that have been sent for this TE link.

lmpTeTestStatusFailureRetransmit.name: lmpTeTestStatusFailureRetransmit
lmpTeTestStatusFailureRetransmit.description: This object counts the number of TestStatusFailure messages that have been retransmitted on this TE link.

lmpTeTestStatusAckReceived.name: lmpTeTestStatusAckReceived
lmpTeTestStatusAckReceived.description: This object counts the number of TestStatusAck messages that have been received for this TE link.

lmpTeTestStatusAckSent.name: lmpTeTestStatusAckSent
lmpTeTestStatusAckSent.description: This object counts the number of TestStatusAck messages that have been sent for this TE link.

lmpTeLinkSummaryReceived.name: lmpTeLinkSummaryReceived
lmpTeLinkSummaryReceived.description: This object counts the number of LinkSummary messages that have been received for this TE link.

lmpTeLinkSummarySent.name: lmpTeLinkSummarySent
lmpTeLinkSummarySent.description: This object counts the number of LinkSummary messages that have been sent for this TE link.

lmpTeLinkSummaryRetransmit.name: lmpTeLinkSummaryRetransmit
lmpTeLinkSummaryRetransmit.description: This object counts the number of LinkSummary messages that have been retransmitted over this control channel.

lmpTeLinkSummaryAckReceived.name: lmpTeLinkSummaryAckReceived
lmpTeLinkSummaryAckReceived.description: This object counts the number of LinkSummaryAck messages that have been received for this TE link.

lmpTeLinkSummaryAckSent.name: lmpTeLinkSummaryAckSent
lmpTeLinkSummaryAckSent.description: This object counts the number of LinkSummaryAck messages that have been sent for this TE link.

lmpTeLinkSummaryNackReceived.name: lmpTeLinkSummaryNackReceived
lmpTeLinkSummaryNackReceived.description: This object counts the number of LinkSummaryNack messages that have been received for this TE link.

lmpTeLinkSummaryNackSent.name: lmpTeLinkSummaryNackSent
lmpTeLinkSummaryNackSent.description: This object counts the number of LinkSummaryNack messages that have been sent for this TE link.

lmpTeChannelStatusReceived.name: lmpTeChannelStatusReceived
lmpTeChannelStatusReceived.description: This object counts the number of ChannelStatus messages that have been received for this TE link.

lmpTeChannelStatusSent.name: lmpTeChannelStatusSent
lmpTeChannelStatusSent.description: This object counts the number of ChannelStatus messages that have been sent for this TE link.

lmpTeChannelStatusRetransmit.name: lmpTeChannelStatusRetransmit
lmpTeChannelStatusRetransmit.description: This object counts the number of ChannelStatus messages that have been retransmitted for this TE link.

lmpTeChannelStatusAckReceived.name: lmpTeChannelStatusAckReceived
lmpTeChannelStatusAckReceived.description: This object counts the number of ChannelStatusAck messages that have been received for this TE link.

lmpTeChannelStatusAckSent.name: lmpTeChannelStatusAckSent
lmpTeChannelStatusAckSent.description: This object counts the number of ChannelStatus messages that have been sent for this TE link.

lmpTeChannelStatusReqReceived.name: lmpTeChannelStatusReqReceived
lmpTeChannelStatusReqReceived.description: This object counts the number of ChannelStatusRequest messages that have been received for this TE link.

lmpTeChannelStatusReqSent.name: lmpTeChannelStatusReqSent
lmpTeChannelStatusReqSent.description: This object counts the number of ChannelStatusRequest messages that have been sent for this TE link.

lmpTeChannelStatusReqRetransmit.name: lmpTeChannelStatusReqRetransmit
lmpTeChannelStatusReqRetransmit.description: This object counts the number of ChannelStatusRequest messages that have been retransmitted for this TE link.

lmpTeChannelStatusRspReceived.name: lmpTeChannelStatusRspReceived
lmpTeChannelStatusRspReceived.description: This object counts the number of ChannelStatusResponse messages that have been received for this TE link.

lmpTeChannelStatusRspSent.name: lmpTeChannelStatusRspSent
lmpTeChannelStatusRspSent.description: This object counts the number of ChannelStatusResponse messages that have been sent for this TE link.

lmpTeCounterDiscontinuityTime.name: lmpTeCounterDiscontinuityTime
lmpTeCounterDiscontinuityTime.description: The value of sysUpTime on the most recent occasion at which one or more of this TE link's counters suffered a discontinuity. The relevant counters are the specific instances associated with this TE link of any Counter32 object contained in the lmpTeLinkPerfTable. If no such discontinuities have occurred since the last re- initialization of the local management subsystem, then this object contains a zero value.

lmpDataLinkTable.name: lmpDataLinkTable
lmpDataLinkTable.description: This table specifies the data-bearing links managed by the LMP.

lmpDataLinkEntry.name: lmpDataLinkEntry
lmpDataLinkEntry.description: An entry in this table exists for each ifEntry that represents a data-bearing link. An ifEntry with an ifIndex must exist before the corresponding lmpDataLinkEntry is created. If an entry representing the data-bearing link is destroyed in the ifTable, then so is the corresponding entry in the lmpDataLinkTable. The administrative status value is controlled from the ifEntry. The index to this table is also used to get information in the componentLinkTable of the TE-LINK-STD-MIB MIB module.

lmpDataLinkType.name: lmpDataLinkType
lmpDataLinkType.description: This attribute specifies whether this data-bearing link is a port or a component link. Component links are multiplex capable, whereas ports are not multiplex capable.

lmpDataLinkAddressType.name: lmpDataLinkAddressType
lmpDataLinkAddressType.description: This attribute specifies the data-bearing link IP address type. If the data-bearing link is unnumbered, the address type must be set to unknown(0).

lmpDataLinkIpAddr.name: lmpDataLinkIpAddr
lmpDataLinkIpAddr.description: The local Internet address for numbered links. The type of this address is determined by the value of lmpDataLinkAddressType object. For IPv4 and IPv6 numbered links, this object represents the local IP address associated with the data-bearing link. For an unnumbered link, the local address is of type unknown, and this object is set to the zero-length string; the ifIndex object then identifies the unnumbered address.

lmpDataLinkRemoteIpAddress.name: lmpDataLinkRemoteIpAddress
lmpDataLinkRemoteIpAddress.description: The remote Internet address for numbered data-bearing links. The type of this address is determined by the lmpDataLinkAddressType object. For IPv4 and IPv6 numbered links, this object represents the remote IP address associated with the data-bearing link. For an unnumbered link, the remote address is of type unknown, and this object is set to the zero-length string; the lmpDataLinkRemoteIfId object then identifies the unnumbered address. This information is either configured manually or communicated by the remote node during the link verification procedure.

lmpDataLinkRemoteIfId.name: lmpDataLinkRemoteIfId
lmpDataLinkRemoteIfId.description: Interface identifier of the remote end point. This information is either configured manually or communicated by the remote node during the link verification procedure.

lmpDataLinkEncodingType.name: lmpDataLinkEncodingType
lmpDataLinkEncodingType.reference: Generalized MPLS Signaling Functional Description, RFC 3471.
lmpDataLinkEncodingType.description: The encoding type of the data-bearing link.

lmpDataLinkActiveOperStatus.name: lmpDataLinkActiveOperStatus
lmpDataLinkActiveOperStatus.description: The actual operational status of this data-bearing link (active FSM).

lmpDataLinkPassiveOperStatus.name: lmpDataLinkPassiveOperStatus
lmpDataLinkPassiveOperStatus.description: The actual operational status of this data-bearing link (passive FSM).

lmpDataLinkRowStatus.name: lmpDataLinkRowStatus
lmpDataLinkRowStatus.description: This variable is used to create, modify, and/or delete a row in this table. None of the writable objects in a row can be changed if the status is active(1). All read-create objects must have valid and consistent values before the row can be activated.

lmpDataLinkStorageType.name: lmpDataLinkStorageType
lmpDataLinkStorageType.description: The storage type for this conceptual row in the lmpDataLinkTable. Conceptual rows having the value 'permanent' need not allow write-access to any columnar object in the row.

lmpDataLinkPerfTable.name: lmpDataLinkPerfTable
lmpDataLinkPerfTable.description: This table specifies the data-bearing links LMP performance counters.

lmpDataLinkPerfEntry.name: lmpDataLinkPerfEntry
lmpDataLinkPerfEntry.description: An entry in this table contains information about the LMP performance counters for the data-bearing links. lmpDataLinkDiscontinuityTime is used to indicate potential discontinuity for all counter objects in this table.

lmpDataLinkTestReceived.name: lmpDataLinkTestReceived
lmpDataLinkTestReceived.description: This object counts the number of Test messages that have been received on this data-bearing link.

lmpDataLinkTestSent.name: lmpDataLinkTestSent
lmpDataLinkTestSent.description: This object counts the number of Test messages that have been sent on this data-bearing link.

lmpDataLinkActiveTestSuccess.name: lmpDataLinkActiveTestSuccess
lmpDataLinkActiveTestSuccess.description: This object counts the number of data-bearing link tests that were successful on the active side of this data- bearing link.

lmpDataLinkActiveTestFailure.name: lmpDataLinkActiveTestFailure
lmpDataLinkActiveTestFailure.description: This object counts the number of data-bearing link tests that failed on the active side of this data-bearing link.

lmpDataLinkPassiveTestSuccess.name: lmpDataLinkPassiveTestSuccess
lmpDataLinkPassiveTestSuccess.description: This object counts the number of data-bearing link tests that were successful on the passive side of this data- bearing link.

lmpDataLinkPassiveTestFailure.name: lmpDataLinkPassiveTestFailure
lmpDataLinkPassiveTestFailure.description: This object counts the number of data-bearing link tests that failed on the passive side of this data-bearing link.

lmpDataLinkDiscontinuityTime.name: lmpDataLinkDiscontinuityTime
lmpDataLinkDiscontinuityTime.description: The value of sysUpTime on the most recent occasion at which one or more of this data-bearing link's counters suffered a discontinuity. The relevant counters are the specific instances associated with this data-bearing link of any Counter32 object contained in the lmpDataLinkPerfTable. If no such discontinuities have occurred since the last re- initialization of the local management subsystem, then this object contains a zero value.

lmpNotificationMaxRate.name: lmpNotificationMaxRate
lmpNotificationMaxRate.description: The LMP notification rate depends on the size of the network, the type of links, the network configuration, the reliability of the network, etc. When this MIB was designed, care was taken to minimize the amount of notifications generated for LMP purposes. Wherever possible, notifications are state driven, meaning that the notifications are sent only when the system changes state. The only notifications that are repeated and that could cause a problem as far as congestion is concerned are the ones associated with data link verification. Without any considerations to handling of these notifications, a problem may arise if the number of data links is high. Since the data link verification notifications can happen only once per data link per link verification interval, the notification rate should be sustainable if one chooses an appropriate link verification interval for a given network configuration. For instance, a network of 100 nodes with 5 links of 128 wavelengths each and a link verification of 1 minute, where no more than 10% of the links failed at any given time, would have 1 notification per second sent from each node, or 100 notifications per second for the whole network. The rest of the notifications are negligible compared to this number. To alleviate the congestion problem, the lmpNotificationMaxRate object can be used to implement a throttling mechanism. It is also possible to enable/disable certain type of notifications. This variable indicates the maximum number of notifications issued per minute. If events occur more rapidly, the implementation may simply fail to emit these notifications during that period or may queue them until an appropriate time. A value of 0 means that no throttling is applied and events may be notified at the rate at which they occur. Implementations should save the value of this object in persistent memory so that it survives restarts or reboot.

lmpLinkPropertyNotificationsEnabled.name: lmpLinkPropertyNotificationsEnabled
lmpLinkPropertyNotificationsEnabled.description: If this object is true(1), then it enables the generation of lmpTeLinkPropertyMismatch and lmpDataLinkPropertyMismatch notifications; otherwise, these notifications are not emitted. Implementations should save the value of this object in persistent memory so that it survives restarts or reboot.

lmpUnprotectedNotificationsEnabled.name: lmpUnprotectedNotificationsEnabled
lmpUnprotectedNotificationsEnabled.description: If this object is true(1), then it enables the generation of lmpUnprotected notifications; otherwise, these notifications are not emitted. Implementations should save the value of this object in persistent memory so that it survives restarts or reboot.

lmpCcUpDownNotificationsEnabled.name: lmpCcUpDownNotificationsEnabled
lmpCcUpDownNotificationsEnabled.description: If this object is true(1), then it enables the generation of lmpControlChannelUp and lmpControlChannelDown notifications; otherwise, these notifications are not emitted. Implementations should save the value of this object in persistent memory so that it survives restarts or reboot.

lmpTeLinkNotificationsEnabled.name: lmpTeLinkNotificationsEnabled
lmpTeLinkNotificationsEnabled.description: If this object is true(1), then it enables the generation of lmpTeLinkDegraded and lmpTeLinkNotDegraded notifications; otherwise, these notifications are not emitted. Implementations should save the value of this object in persistent memory so that it survives restarts or reboot.

lmpDataLinkNotificationsEnabled.name: lmpDataLinkNotificationsEnabled
lmpDataLinkNotificationsEnabled.description: If this object is true(1), then it enables the generation of lmpDataLinkVerificationFailure notification; otherwise, these notifications are not emitted. Implementations should save the value of this object in persistent memory so that it survives restarts or reboot.

lmpTeLinkPropertyMismatch.name: lmpTeLinkPropertyMismatch
lmpTeLinkPropertyMismatch.description: This notification is generated when a TE link property mismatch is detected on the node. The received remote TE link ID of the misconfigured TE link is represented by either teLinkRemoteIpAddr or teLinkIncomingIfId, depending on whether the TE link is numbered or unnumbered. This notification should not be sent unless lmpLinkPropertyNotificationsEnabled is true(1). It is recommended that this notification be reported only the first time a mismatch is detected. Otherwise, for a given TE link, this notification can occur no more than once per verification interval (lmpGlobalLinkVerificationInterval).

lmpDataLinkPropertyMismatch.name: lmpDataLinkPropertyMismatch
lmpDataLinkPropertyMismatch.description: This notification is generated when a data-bearing link property mismatch is detected on the node. lmpDataLinkType is used to identify the local identifiers associated with the data link. (The data link interface index can be used to determine the TE link interface index, as this relationship is captured in the interface stack table.) The remote entity interface ID is the remote entity interface ID received in the LinkSummary message. This notification should not be sent unless lmpLinkPropertyNotificationsEnabled is true(1). It is recommended that this notification be reported only the first time a mismatch is detected. Otherwise, for a given data link, this notification can occur no more than once per verification interval (lmpGlobalLinkVerificationInterval).

lmpUnprotected.name: lmpUnprotected
lmpUnprotected.description: This notification is generated when there is more than one control channel between LMP neighbors and the last redundant control channel has failed. If the remaining operational control channel fails, then there will be no more control channels between the pair of nodes and all the TE links between the pair of nodes, will go to degraded state. This notification should not be sent unless lmpUnprotectedNotificationsEnabled is set to true(1).

lmpControlChannelUp.name: lmpControlChannelUp
lmpControlChannelUp.description: This notification is generated when a control channel transitions to the up operational state. This notification should not be sent unless lmpCcUpDownNotificationsEnabled is true(1).

lmpControlChannelDown.name: lmpControlChannelDown
lmpControlChannelDown.description: This notification is generated when a control channel transitions out of the up operational state. This notification should not be sent unless lmpCcUpDownNotificationsEnabled is true(1).

lmpTeLinkDegraded.name: lmpTeLinkDegraded
lmpTeLinkDegraded.description: This notification is generated when a lmpTeLinkOperStatus object for a TE link enters the degraded state. This notification should not be sent unless lmpTeLinkNotificationsEnabled is true(1).

lmpTeLinkNotDegraded.name: lmpTeLinkNotDegraded
lmpTeLinkNotDegraded.description: This notification is generated when a lmpTeLinkOperStatus object for a TE link leaves the degraded state. This notification should not be sent unless lmpTeLinkNotificationsEnabled is true(1).

lmpDataLinkVerificationFailure.name: lmpDataLinkVerificationFailure
lmpDataLinkVerificationFailure.description: This notification is generated when a data-bearing link verification fails. This notification should not be sent unless lmpDataLinkNotificationsEnabled is true(1). For a given data link, this notification can occur no more than once per verification interval (lmpGlobalLinkVerificationInterval).

lmpModuleFullCompliance.name: lmpModuleFullCompliance
lmpModuleFullCompliance.description: Compliance statement for agents that support the configuration and monitoring of LMP MIB.

lmpModuleReadOnlyCompliance.name: lmpModuleReadOnlyCompliance
lmpModuleReadOnlyCompliance.description: Compliance statement for agents that support the monitoring of the LMP MIB.

lmpNodeGroup.name: lmpNodeGroup
lmpNodeGroup.description: Collection of objects that represent LMP node configuration.

lmpControlChannelGroup.name: lmpControlChannelGroup
lmpControlChannelGroup.description: Objects that can be used to configure LMP interface.

lmpCcIsInterfaceGroup.name: lmpCcIsInterfaceGroup
lmpCcIsInterfaceGroup.description: Objects that can be used to configure control channels that are interfaces.

lmpCcIsNotInterfaceGroup.name: lmpCcIsNotInterfaceGroup
lmpCcIsNotInterfaceGroup.description: Objects that can be used to configure control channels that are not interfaces.

lmpLinkPropertyCorrelationGroup.name: lmpLinkPropertyCorrelationGroup
lmpLinkPropertyCorrelationGroup.description: Collection of objects used to configure the link property correlation procedure.

lmpLinkVerificationGroup.name: lmpLinkVerificationGroup
lmpLinkVerificationGroup.description: Collection of objects that represent the link verification procedure configuration.

lmpPerfGroup.name: lmpPerfGroup
lmpPerfGroup.description: Collection of objects used to provide performance information about LMP interfaces and data-bearing links.

lmpTeLinkGroup.name: lmpTeLinkGroup
lmpTeLinkGroup.description: Objects that can be used to configure TE links.

lmpDataLinkGroup.name: lmpDataLinkGroup
lmpDataLinkGroup.description: Collection of objects that represent data-bearing link configuration.

lmpNotificationGroup.name: lmpNotificationGroup
lmpNotificationGroup.description: Set of notifications defined in this module.
